items.title: Israel's 'hearts lie in tatters' as Hamas hands over first dead hostages
items.description: They are believed to include the Bibas family, who for Israel have become a symbol of the captives.

items.title: Spain's ex-football boss Luis Rubiales fined for World Cup kiss
items.description: Luis Rubiales has been found guilty of kissing player Jenni Hermoso without her consent and fined â‚¬10,800.

items.title: BBC faces questions over Gaza film's Hamas link
items.description: The documentary Gaza: How To Survive A War Zone was narrated by the son of a Hamas official.

items.title: Passengers on crashed Toronto plane offered US$30,000 each
items.description: The gesture to the affected travellers - all of whom survived - comes with no strings attached, the airline says.

items.title: Children routinely using social media, Australian regulator says
items.description: It found they were easily able to bypass age checks on apps, which face being banned for under-16s.
